Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice with handle root; interior glazed (fired red-brown); two bands in added white near bottom; exterior: maeander band running left; at right, part of dividing band and handle root; below, band above trace of possible maeander frieze, above rays; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number '10' is written in pencil on the sherd's exterior surface. Probably from same chalice as 1924,1201.644.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 239, no. 193)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (pl. 20.3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0097) (phase 2)
